The Oakley House proved to be the perfect quiet retreat after spending time in the area visiting Shiloh National Battlefield and Corinth area Civil War history. The porch was a relaxing place to hang out, play checkers and ring toss, or just rock in the rockers. One fall night we enjoyed a fire in the fire pit - even the firewood was provided! The grill and sparkling clean modern kitchen made it easy to choose to enjoy dinner at "home".
But the best part about this rustic yet modern log cabin was the detail that Jimmy-Jill thoughtfully provided. No skimping on anything. Bath towels were thick, soft and thirsty; soft warm throws were there to cuddle up in the oversize comfy chairs and watch the inside gas fireplace or satellite television on the flat screen TV. The wifi worked flawlessly.
Checking in couldn't have been simpler. The rural location is conveniently only a few miles from Corinth and other local attractions.
Rent the Oakley House, you'll be glad you chose it for your getaway! THANK YOU Jimmy and Jill.

Great location from which to explore Corinth and the Shiloh battlefield (20 minutes away). David and Kim provided many brochures for local attractions geared toward my interests, and also numerous restaurant recommendations. I enjoyed Pizza Grocery in Corinth and Hagy’s Catfish Hotel on the Tennessee River near Shiloh. For a unique dish local to this region, try the Slugburger at Borroum’s Drug Store in Corinth.
